snippet.title: Gas tanker erupts in flames along Pacific Motorway
snippet.content: A gas tanker has erupted in flames on the Pacific Motorway at Loganholme. Emergency services were called to southbound lanes on the motorway near the Logan Hyperdome after reports a truck carrying a "volatile substance" was on fire, police said.Photo: Jodie Ann Riches Three fire crews were working to control the blaze that was billowing "large volumes of black smoke". Police have asked nearby businesses to evacuate. Police have closed the southbound lanes, with traffic being diverted off at the Bryant Road exit. Police said the northbound lanes along the motorway may also close and have urged motorists to avoid the area.
